item.title: Father of three meets bone marrow donor who saved his life for 'most special Christmas'
item.description: Battling acute myeloid leukaemia, Gennaro Rapinese finally found a suitable bone marrow donor on the other side of the world in the US. And, after making a full recovery, he got to thank her in person in the lead-up to Christmas.

item.title: Tarina Warren has been legally blind since she was 16, now a seeing eye dog is helping her navigate life on Moolooloo Station
item.description: Moolooloo station, nestled in South Australia's Flinders Ranges, might look like your typical outback farm, but the workforce at this station has one unique addition — a black labrador called Mika.

item.title: Convenience over tradition as gen Z and millennials favour pre-peeled prawns over the Christmas period
item.description: New research shows younger Aussies prefer to save time and mess by buying pre-peeled prawns over the festive season.

item.description: The men, both in their 60s, crashed at the intersection of Main South Road and Sunvalley Road in O'Halloran Hill on Tuesday.

item.description: A bushfire emergency in Warradarge is over, but farmers say the work to recover what was lost has only just begun.

item.title: Tropical Cyclone Grant approaches Cocos (Keeling) Islands as severe Christmas heatwave scorches WA
item.description: Preparations are underway far off Western Australia's north-west coast for the impact of a category one cyclone as Perth and much of the state continues to swelter in heatwave conditions.

item.title: Sydney to Hobart yacht race not expecting repeat of last year's horrific conditions
item.description: The Sydney to Hobart fleet is in for milder conditions this year than in 2024, when two people died on the first night of racing, although sailors have been warned to expect strong winds.

item.description: The US government says newly released documents from the Epstein files contain "untrue and sensationalist" claims about Donald Trump.

item.title: Sewage leak prompts Broadwater swimming warning ahead of Christmas
item.description: Swimmers and boaties are being warned to avoid part of the Gold Coast Broadwater at Biggera Waters after a sewage leak just days out from Christmas.

item.title: Young motorcyclist warns others after surviving high-speed crash
item.description: Liam Ganter does not remember the crash that nearly killed him, but he is living with the consequences, and hopes his story will stop others making the same mistake.

item.title: Man in his 30s dies in e-scooter accident in Geraldton
item.description: Police say a man has died after losing control of an e-scooter in Geraldton overnight.

item.title: Concerns over abortion, vasectomies, IVF, gender-affirming care access as Catholic organisation Calvary buys Hobart Private
item.description: The operator of the Hobart Private Hospital has agreed to sell the facility to Catholic healthcare provider Calvary, leading to concerns about access to surgical abortions, vasectomies and some other legal procedures.

item.title: England skipper Ben Stokes defends his team as Jofra Archer ruled out of Ashes
item.description: England's disastrous Ashes tour has received another blow with Jofra Archer ruled out of the remaining two Tests while skipper Ben Stokes has dug in to defend his beleaguered team.

item.title: Alice Springs veteran Geoffrey Shaw remembered as tireless advocate for Aboriginal rights
item.description: Alice Springs war veteran Geoffrey Shaw OAM has been remembered as a tireless advocate for Indigenous rights in Central Australia, who leaves a legacy of courage and service.

item.description: Residents on a remote Indian Ocean territory are bunkering down and scrapping Christmas plans as Tropical Cyclone Grant approaches.

item.title: Even in the markets, it's beginning to look like Christmas
item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: US and Ukraine reach consensus on key issues to end war with Russia but territorial disputes remain
item.description: President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has said that Ukraine has reached consensus with the US on key issues to end the war with Russia but sensitive issues around territorial control, along with the management of a nuclear power plant, still remain unresolved.

item.description: Leaders in Germany, France, Spain and the European Union slam the move as "intimidation and coercion".

item.title: Christmas quiz: How well do you know traditional Christmas carols?

item.title: Gaza's remaining Christians mark Christmas with subdued celebrations
item.description: The small number of Christians remaining in Gaza have marked Christmas early with subdued celebrations in the shadow of ongoing conflict and occupation.

item.title: How political divides are putting more pressure on Australian couples
item.description: More Australian relationships are struggling because of political divides. But experts say this does not have to be the end.

item.title: What you need to know before you buy lab-grown versus natural diamonds
item.description: Diamonds are generally considered a luxury asset that holds its value, but the emergence of laboratory-grown diamonds in the jewellery industry over recent years could challenge that belief.

item.title: Second-hand shopping is a sustainable alternative, but could it be fuelling consumption?
item.description: The rising popularity of second-hand and vintage fashion has been viewed as an opportunity to reduce fast fashion consumption; however, Australia remains one of the world's highest waste producers.

item.description: Despite our screens being filled with images of happy families celebrating Christmas, some feel the festive season is lonelier than ever.

item.description: An Adelaide street artist's poster aimed at provoking thought about national identity has been vandalised with racist graffiti.

item.title: She readies for a 23rd Sydney to Hobart as the crew honours late owner Peter Rodgers
item.description: A fellowship of sailors will embark on She's 23rd Sydney to Hobart campaign. As they do they will honour one of the most resilient boats in the race's history and remember late owner Peter Rodgers.

item.title: Aged care centre confronts racism, improves staff retention with cultural celebrations
item.description: In 2024 a nurse reported racist abuse from some residents and family members. A year later, instances of abuse have plummeted and staff say it is because of a new program promoting respect.

item.description: The Department of Justice says the release of the Epstein files will take "a few more weeks" after a million additional documents were uncovered.

item.description: The White House has ordered US military forces to focus almost exclusively on enforcing the "quarantine" of Venezuelan oil, a US official says.

item.description: Tropical Cyclone Grant is expected to remain a category one system as it passes just to the north of the Cocos (Keeling) Islands off the West Australian coast.

item.title: Australia's 'outback fashion capital' promotes healing through fashion
item.description: Almost three years ago, a region in Western Australia's far north was devastated by once-in-a-century floods. Now fashion is stepping in, to heal scars and promote confidence.

item.description: Snow has arrived in the island state on Christmas morning, but hotter conditions are expected around the country, including a scorcher in the west.

item.description: As film photography surges in popularity among younger generations, technicians who repair analogue cameras are retiring, raising concerns it will become a dying art.

item.title: Public assemblies banned for 14 days across Sydney as police enforce new powers under protest laws
item.description: The NSW Police Commissioner, Mal Lanyon, has activated new powers prescribed under changes to NSW protest laws sparked by the terrorist attack at Bondi Beach on December 14.

item.description: A record crowd for cricket at the MCG saw another fast-forward day of Ashes action as calamitous run outs and wild Bazball batting took centre stage. Here are the quick hits from the Ashes.

item.title: England's cowardly batting response spares Australian blushes on farcical Ashes Boxing Day

item.description: There was no central catalogue for the scattered histories of women's cricket. That may be about to change.

item.description: During the tense campaign for her third term as prime minister of Pakistan, Benazir Bhutto survived one attempt on her life before she was shot dead by a teenage suicide bomber on December 27, 2007. She helped to build a political dynasty that continues.

item.description: England's batters once again fall flat on their faces in the face of tricky conditions at the MCG for the Boxing Day Test.

item.description: For Trevor Harvey, honouring a departed mate meant one thing — finding a 6-metre-tall Kewpie doll from the Sydney Olympics.

item.description: Crews are battling sea sickness and tough conditions as teams head for the finish in the 2025 Sydney to Hobart yacht race.

item.description: An annual meeting to elect a new board at Mallee District Aboriginal Services has led to divisions among members and incoming board members as the chair announces elections will be re-run.

item.description: In a tiny town near the Victoria–South Australia border, a proposed wind farm near a protected wetland is posing a big question for Australia's planning regulators.

item.title: BBL title-holders Hobart Hurricanes beat Perth Scorchers but lose Tim David to hamstring injury
item.description: Hobart's title defence suffers a huge blow after star batter Tim David injures his hamstring in his team's four-wicket win over the Scorchers.

item.title: South Australian playwright pays tribute to late partner in new production
item.description: An upcoming South Australian playwright was writing a horror, comedy show about the prospect of losing a much older partner, then it happened to him.

item.description: North Queenslanders have been playing the ice-based sport broomball for decades, but dwindling numbers and rising costs have players fearing it may be dying.

item.description: Lucinda is a member of an exclusive club — living heart donors, and is the only woman to have a baby after a heart-lung-liver transplant

item.title: 13 long reads to catch up on for your summer holiday
item.description: Here we've gathered a bunch of other things to read while you're relaxing over summer.

item.title: Ladybirds set loose at Australian Parliament House in Canberra over summer to take out pests
item.description: When politicians and most staff are away for the summer holidays, a ravenous group of fly-in workers descend on Parliament House.

item.title: Northern parts of Queensland bracing for heavy rainfall, potential flooding
item.description: Holiday travellers are being urged to check road closures before setting off on their journey, with parts of the state expecting rain into the middle of next week.

item.title: Former football manager Harry Redknapp wins King George VI Chase with The Jukebox Man
item.description: Harry Redknapp is known for his long career as a football manager, but on Boxing Day his horse The Jukebox Man wins famous jumps race the King George VI Chase in one of the all-time great finishes.

item.title: 175-year-old Nor' West Bend Station reopened to public after decades of restoration work
item.description: History is being brought back to life at a former pastoral station that has seen drought, boom and bust over the course of its 175 years.

item.title: Somalia, Arab nations denounce Israeli recognition of Somaliland
item.description: Matters of strategy are behind Israel's drive to recognise Somaliland, analysts say, as Arab nations worry about instability in the region.

item.title: Myanmar's first election in five years begins – but experts warn it's a sham
item.description: Five years after the military toppled a democratically elected government and imprisoned its leaders, the country is preparing to hold national elections beginning on December 28.

item.title: Ashes 2025: England wins first Test in Australia in 5,468 days after two-day MCG match
item.description: England survives a nervy run chase to win its first Test match on Australian soil since 2011 in a manic two-day encounter in Melbourne.

item.title: Mosque blast during Friday noon prayers kills eight in Syria
item.description: The attack has been claimed by the ultra-conservative Sunni group Saraya Ansar al-Sunnah, which was also responsible for a Damascus church bombing in June.

item.title: Trio of retirees from Dongara win award for community rubbish collection
item.description: Armed with gloves, bags, buckets and tongs, a trio of passionate rubbish removalists have picked up an award in this regional Western Australia town.

item.title: Storm Hunter returns for the Australian summer targeting a top doubles ranking
item.description: Popular Australian Storm Hunter is back from injury and adamant she can return to the form that made her the world's top-ranked doubles player.

item.title: Australians are drinking less, but one cohort won't give up the booze
item.description: Health-conscious Australians may be thinking twice about having that first or second beer, but not all of us are getting the message when it comes to alcohol and risky drinking.

item.title: These volunteer firefighters keep communities safe. Here's why
item.description: Volunteer firefighters put their lives on the line for their community, despite facing extreme situations, heightened health risks and constant exposure to traumatic events.

item.description: China urged the US to "stop the dangerous moves of arming Taiwan" after its multi-billion-dollar sale of weapons last week.

item.title: Ukrainian capital Kyiv under Russian attack, officials say
item.description: Explosions have been heard, air defences are in operation and the military is on alert for impending missile attacks.

item.title: How a tsunami in Sri Lanka sparked a push to prevent drowning
item.description: What began as tsunami relief, has become something more powerful — teaching children not to fear the water that surrounds them.

item.title: Thailand and Cambodia agree to ceasefire, ending weeks of clashes

item.title: Urban water restrictions likely across Victoria as dam levels drop and dry summer predicted
item.description: Victoria's water storage levels have dropped to 61 per cent capacity after most of the state recorded below average rainfall in 2025.

item.title: Robots, AI and 'smart tourism' will change how we travel
item.description: Will new technology lead to streamlined service and stress-free travel, or will it fundamentally change tourism and tourist destinations?

item.description: Residents have begun returning to their homes after a bushfire burning south-east of Perth forced them to flee on Christmas Day.

item.title: Hobart family reunited with dog nearly four years after it disappeared from home
item.description: A blurry photo on social media has led to a Hobart family reuniting with their missing dog nearly four years after it vanished from their home.

item.title: Gus Atkinson injured and Marnus Labuschagne struggles again as Bazball pays off for England — five quick hits from day two of the Boxing Day Ashes Test

item.title: Ashes 2025: Calls for MCG Boxing Day Test pitch to be rated 'poor' as England and Australia batting criticised
item.description: After the first Test of the Ashes series sensationally ended in just two days, Cricket Australia hoped it wouldn't see that again for a century. It's happened again five weeks later.

item.description: Russia has attacked Ukraine with hundreds of missiles and drones ahead of what President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said would be a crucial meeting with Donald Trump to work out a deal to end nearly four years of war.

item.title: The vibe shift is here and it's not what we expected
item.description: From the rise of misinformation and AI to escalating political tensions, vast economic disparity, and the erosion of social bonds, the vibe shift is now understood as a deep, unsettling change in our collective reality.

item.title: Steroid use is 'exploding' — but there are no clinical guidelines on how to quit

item.title: Parents in China use AI technology to monitor children's homework

item.title: Cyber attacks that occurred this year and how you can protect your data

item.title: How the teen social media ban is impacting Australia’s multicultural communities
item.description: Sydney teenager Ilia Kyrychenko was relieved to delete his accounts after the social media ban, but the change is making it more difficult to connect with his loved ones in Ukraine.

item.title: Brisbane Heat beats Adelaide Strikers by seven runs, thanks to debutant Tom Balkin
item.description: Injury to Shaheen Afridi leaves debutant Tom Balkin to bowl the final over, and the 21-year-old delivers to help Brisbane Heat to a seven-run BBL win over Adelaide Strikers.

item.title: Experts say climate change bigger threat to biodiversity than renewable energy projects
item.description: As the green energy boom gathers pace, experts say climate change is a bigger threat to biodiversity than wind farms and other renewables projects.

item.title: Matthew Hauser became world triathlon champion in 2025. Now, he wants to win Olympic gold for Australia
item.description: Matthew Hauser has always dreamed of becoming a triathlete. After achieving incredible feats this year, the world champion is now eyeing a spot on the Australian Olympic squad.

item.title: What was on summer reading lists 100 years ago, in 1925?
item.description: There are books from authors that would become household names — F. Scott Fitzgerald and A.A Milne among them — and books that are now banned in some countries. But what can we learn from what people were reading in 1925?

item.title: Mentors gave me confidence to navigate life with a disability. Now I'm giving back
item.description: Other people with lived experience of blindness gave ABC reporter Nas Campanella the confidence to navigate life. Her mentee, Lily, is enjoying similar benefits.

item.title: NTFL umpires say FIFO growth to blame for declining standards
item.description: Jared Collins has officiated nearly a thousand NT footy games, but says an ongoing dispute between AFLNT and its umpires has forced him to hang up the whistle.

item.title: A rescued dingo puppy explores its new surroundings.
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Dingo management should be 'non-lethal', traditional owners say
item.description: When Sonya sees a black-and-tan dingo, she feels a connection to family and Country, but many landholders see them as livestock-killing pests. Can graziers and dingoes co-exist?

item.title: Kennedy Center boss criticises musician who cancelled performance after Trump rebrand
item.description: Musician Chuck Redd cancelled his Christmas Eve show days after the White House announced the venue would be renamed the Trump Kennedy Center.

item.title: Weatherald, Labuschagne, Green under Ashes selection pressure after MCG loss
item.description: Jake Weatherald, Marnus Labuschagne and Cameron Green all face selection pressure following double failures in Australia's jarring loss at the MCG.

item.title: A career for all ages: Meet the truckies keeping Australia on the road
item.description: At 83, truck driver Terry Bairstow says he would not change a thing after spending six decades behind the wheel carting grain and sheep.

item.title: What to know about the Islamic State militants targeted by US air strikes
item.description: With US President Donald Trump hinting at plans for further strikes on IS militants in Nigeria, here's a rundown on what you need to know about the conflict.

item.title: Hands-on memories spark connection for dementia residents at western NSW aged care home
item.description: Creating meaningful, sensory activities for people living with dementia can be challenging, particularly when many traditional options feel more suited to children than adults with a lifetime of lived experience behind them.

item.title: Man charged for allegedly displaying hate symbol tattoos at Newcastle beach
item.description: A man has been charged for allegedly displaying what police have called "hate symbol" tattoos at a beach in Newcastle.

item.title: Rockingham's leap to major AUKUS defence hub leaves some locals trepidatious
item.description: Rockingham in Perth's south is fast becoming a crucial part of the AUKUS nuclear submarine deal, with promises of a big boost in jobs and infrastructure — but it's also leaving residents afraid for their lives and lifestyle.

item.title: From soapboxes to social media: Two artists shaping Queensland's bush art scene
item.description: Marion Moore is 101. Zarabella Bambling is 23. Despite their differences, both women have just celebrated the same major achievement as bush artists.

item.title: Veteran train driver calls time on 70-year career that 'will never happen again'
item.description: Peter Sawtell remembers making friends and enemies, keeping fit behind a diesel engine, and even meeting King Charles III during his "legendary" career.

item.title: Former Australian fast bowler Brett Lee inducted into the Australian Cricket Hall of Fame
item.description: Renowned for his express pace, former fast bowler Brett Lee is the latest inductee into the Australian Cricket Hall of Fame.

item.title: Why getting more migrants to swim has benefits for all of Australian society
item.description: Despite wanting to learn how to swim, many from culturally and linguistically diverse communities — particularly adults — face three key barriers to participating.

item.title: The case of the Guayaquil Four places scrutiny on Ecuador's security crackdown
item.description: In the weeks before Christmas, four boys under 16 left home to play a game of soccer. Their forced disappearance at the hands of Ecuador's military has been labelled a national "turning point".

item.title: Major travel disruptions across north of United States amid heavy snowfall
item.description: At least 1,500 flights were cancelled across the country as some areas received up to 25 centimetres of snow.

item.title: Spanish soccer coach missing after tourist boat sinks in Indonesia's Komodo National Park
item.description: The Labuan Bajo port authority attributes the sinking to high waves of up to three metres, but rescuers say they are "determined" to find survivors.

item.title: 'Grumpy' seal disrupts Blairgowrie boat race on Victoria's Mornington Peninsula
item.description: A wild seal dubbed "Grumpy" causes some commotion at an annual boat race on the Mornington Peninsula, outside Melbourne.

item.title: MCG curator Matt Page admits Boxing Day Test pitch 'favoured the bowlers too much'
item.description: MCC boss Stuart Fox staunchly defends chief curator Matt Page after a wild Boxing Day Test finishes within two days.

item.title: Coral Adventurer runs aground off Papua New Guinea with 120 people onboard
item.description: The Coral Adventurer has run aground off the coast of Papua New Guinea with more than 120 people aboard, two months after the death of a passenger allegedly left behind on a Great Barrier Reef island.

item.title: SA independent MP Nick McBride charged with assault
item.description: Police say they responded to reports of a domestic assault at a home in South Australia's south-east on Saturday.

item.title: Extreme fire conditions forecast for South Australia on Monday
item.description: Authorities are warning people to be prepared as hot and windy conditions sweep across the state.

item.title: Queensland's annual road death toll reaches 16-year high as police target drink driving, e-mobility devices
item.description: More than 300 people have died on Queensland roads this year, with four additional deaths already recorded over the Christmas period. It has prompted a plea from authorities to ensure it does not get higher.

item.title: Sending army to protect Sydney's Jewish community not ruled out by NSW premier
item.description: Sydneysiders can expect to see more police officers carrying long-armed guns in the weeks ahead, with the premier not ruling out sending troops to protect the Jewish community.

item.title: Taiwan's cunning tax compliance makes most shopping receipts a ticket in a lottery
item.description: Most shopping receipts in Taiwan are also tickets for a lottery run every second month by the government to increase tax compliance, and there are some big prizes up for grabs.

item.title: Comanche takes out line honours in 2025 Sydney to Hobart Yacht Race — as it happened
item.description: Master Lock Comanche claims line honours in the 80th edition of the gruelling Sydney to Hobart yacht race, with a stunning daylight hours finish, making up for retiring early in last year's race.

item.title: Tasmanian woman dies in glider crash at Tunbridge, pilot airlifted to Royal Hobart Hospital
item.description: A woman has died and a man has been taken to hospital following a glider crash at a private airfield in Tasmania.

item.title: Police say Indigenous woman's death in custody was result of 'medical episode'
item.description: Northern Territory Police say the death in custody of an Indigenous woman in Tennant Creek on Saturday was the result of a "medical episode", while admitting there was no nurse on duty at the time.

item.title: Teenagers charged after alleged aggravated carjacking in Melbourne's south-east
item.description: An overnight police chase across multiple suburbs has ended with the arrest of three teenagers after an alleged aggravated carjacking in Melbourne's south-east.

item.title: Comanche wins Sydney to Hobart line honours
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Brigitte Bardot, iconic French actor, sex symbol and animal rights campaigner, dies aged 91
item.description: The French actor and singer was a screen siren of the 1950s and 1960s who in later life became a prominent animal rights campaigner.

item.title: Brigitte Bardot was the world's 'sex kitten'. Her nonchalance was all French
item.description: Few epitomised French chic like Brigitte Bardot, the doe-eyed beauty whose sensuality rocked a post-war world.

item.title: Families of Bondi victims call for federal royal commission
item.description: Loved ones of those killed and injured in the Bondi Beach attack say rising antisemitism requires a "powerful national response", piling pressure on Anthony Albanese for a royal commission.

item.title: Nick Kyrgios defeats Aryna Sabalenka in latest 'battle of the sexes'
item.description: Australia's Nick Kyrgios defeated women's world number one Aryna Sabalenka in the latest "battle of the sexes". The Aussie, who has fallen outside the ATP top 600 after barely playing for three years, won 6-3, 6-3.

item.title: A growing number of older women surfers are showing age is just a state of mind
item.description: When Katie Pahlow turned 60, she decided to finally bite the bullet and book herself in for some surf lessons.

item.title: This week in history quiz, December 29: How well do you remember this week in history?
item.description: Test your knowledge with questions about Shane Warne, Frank Sinatra and Australia's first stamp.

item.title: Sarah Larcombe's journey back to the top of the paraclimbing world after devastating injuries
item.description: When Sarah Larcombe fell off Mount Arapiles in February, she thought she just sprained her ankle. What followed was months of ups and downs ending in a stunning world championships result.

item.title: Aid agencies fear lifesaving program banned in Gaza under new Israeli requirements
item.description: The Israeli government has introduced new rules for aid organisations, including that they must not engage in any activities or criticism which "delegitimise" the state of Israel.

item.title: Inside Big Ben, a London icon that's been ringing since 1859
item.description: It's among the world's most photographed landmarks, a symbol of the United Kingdom and an engineering marvel. And for London's Big Ben the most important night of the year is fast approaching.

item.title: Furious customers slam ASIC for ignoring Zone RV whistleblower complaints before collapse
item.description: Anger is growing after revelations the corporate watchdog failed to investigate allegations against luxury caravan manufacturer Zone RV.

item.title: Courtesy wave not as common on Australian roads
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Australia's driver courtesy wave dying out, say truckies, but experiment proves wave still alive on back roads
item.description: For generations, the courtesy wave has been etched into the Australian culture, but is it on the verge of dying?

item.title: Overall winner yet to be decided as Sydney to Hobart yacht race enters fourth day
item.description: The yacht race has entered the fourth day, after Master Lock Comanche claimed line honours late on Sunday.

item.title: Drink driver crashes car into the living room of a house in Melbourne's outer west
item.description: A 24-year-old man was taken to hospital after crashing his car into a house in Kurunjang. He failed a breath test at the scene.

item.title: Donald Trump says Ukraine will receive security guarantee as part of peace plan
item.description: Donald Trump is hosting Volodymyr Zelenskyy at Mar-a-lago to discuss the finer points of a 20-point plan put forward by Washington.

item.title: Jade Gooding says in-person or more in-depth consultations are needed for medical weight-loss drugs to prevent vulnerable patients from gaining access.

item.title: Evangeline Gardiner says she often sees ads when she logs onto social media.
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Concerns medical weight-loss treatments are being advertised to vulnerable eating disorder patients
item.description: International company Juniper is among the concerns of eating disorder industry bodies, having run a Black Friday sale and made a social media comment about "pesky Aussie laws" to promote its medications.

item.title: Young women join Country Women's Association Sydney branch in droves
item.description: More young women are joining the Country Women's Association's city branches, with a passion for jams and scones along with social connection and purpose.

item.title: Flooding and record-breaking rain forecast for northern and western Queensland
item.description: Intense rainfall across the north and west of Queensland is forecast to cause widespread flooding with damaging winds and risks to livestock.

item.title: Voter turnout lower than expected in Myanmar's first election since 2020
item.description: Myanmar's election has been widely dismissed as a sham by many governments and human rights activists who have said the military will use proxy candidates to legitimise their rule.

item.title: Travis Head happy to see out Ashes as Australian opener before working out future role
item.description: Australia star Travis Head says he is not precious about continuing to open the batting beyond this Ashes and will bat wherever the coaches tell him to.

item.title: AI powers 2025's economy to record highs. So why are only robots smiling?
item.description: This year saw economies survive tariff shocks and markets burst through record highs, but it doesn't feel like a party because so many people aren't invited.

item.title: Deadly varroa mite threatens half of Canberra’s beehives
item.description: A fast-spreading parasite is expected to devastate local bee colonies over the next two years, affecting commercial and backyard crops.

item.title: LGBTQIA+ focused boxing class combatting loneliness amid warnings about social isolation
item.description: One in three adults experience social isolation in what experts say is a "dangerous" issue in society. One suburban boxing group is working to tackle the issue, focused on the LGBTQIA+ community more at risk of loneliness.

item.title: Cyclone Hayley forms off WA coast and Broome residents told to prepare
item.description: Residents in WA's north are on alert following the formation of Tropical Cyclone Hayley off the coast overnight.
